nodes.Name: Brown University
nodes.Description: Brown University has arrested 61 students to date for peacefully protesting in favor of divestment, and are continuing to press charges on 41.

nodes.Name: Textron
nodes.Description: Textron is a US-based military contractor known for its Bell, Beechcraft, Cessna, and Hawker aircraft brands, used by Israel’s military ground troops in Gaza.

nodes.Name: SpaceX
nodes.Description: SpaceX operates Starlink, which is used by Israel to selectively and conditionally provide internet access in Gaza.

nodes.Name: Alphabet
nodes.Description: Among other things, Alphabet "provides cloud computing services to the Israeli Ministry of Defense". They also operate Project Nimbus, a "$1.2 billion cloud computing and AI agreement between the Israeli government and two tech companies: Google and Amazon." They have fired many employees who have protested and expressed concern over these projects.

links.Description: Maria Zuber has been a Director at Textron since 2016.
Textron donated LaserWave® ultrasonic technology to the Brown University Research Foundation in 2003.
Textron has donated approximatly $28 million to RISD since 1944, including a current annual donation of $10,000/year in scholarships for internships.

RISD/Brown's MADE program receives support from Textron, which could mean "different ways such as hosting site visits or workshops, serving as guest lecturers, critics or mentors, or working with faculty to suggest projects".

Alice Gast served as the President of Lehigh University from 2006-2014.
In 2012, Alice Gast was elected to the Board of Directors of Chevron Corporation while simultaneously serving as the President of Lehigh. She remains on the board of directors.
Alice Gast served as President of Imperial College London from 2014-2022.
